content.description: Start below and to the left of The Clean Ascent, also below and left of a crack system heading up the wall. Pull out of the break up to a right crimp and left gaston. Pump out to the jug rail at the lip, and continue up the crack to top out.
content.location: To the right of the Spice of Life, left of the clean ascent

content.description: Start in the break as for Spice of life, but move right from the side pulls, keeping your feet low and making interesting moves on crimps and a sharp tooth. Move into Whack-A-Bush to finish out the wall.
content.location: Start on spice of life, traverse into whack-a-bush.

content.description: Find two opposing slanted side pulls in the middle of the wall. Start at the break below, and work your way onto these holds using low feet. Stick a righthand crimp flake, and shoot out to the jug at the lip. Pull onto the slab and delicately make your way to the top. Down climb Down Not Out (V0-) or pull on roots etc to top out the wall and walk right to eventually make it back below.
content.location: Ten feet to the right of delirium's cure, see description.

content.description: Start out climbing a rather disgusting slab/finger crack for the first 10' before reaching the enjoyable crack system. Place gear and continue up and left following the cracks and topping out at the highest point on the cliff. Anchor from the trees far above. Not a bad route, but dirty until you reach the cracks. Lots of options for placements, this route was my first gear protected lead.
content.location: Left side of the Winter Wall, this is the vertical crack system that starts about 10' up the wall.

content.description: Ten feet right of the steep section of the wall, look at the obvious crack/flake system with a block (firmly) wedged into it. Follow the break to the top for a very easy mantle. Pull down, not out as the name suggests. Down climb, or take care to top out through some roots and shrubs.
content.location: a big gross crack to the right of the cave area on the winter wall

climbs.name: Delirium's  Cure
climbs.fa: John Branscombe Late 90's, re-discovered by local hooligans 2013

content.description: The obvious line on the far left end of the steep wall. Start on a good right hand crimp, and a decent chip for the left. Move up through some tension based holds, up to the big move to the hold over the lip. Itâ€™s not actually over. Pull your way onto the slab, then keep it together for a few easy moves, and a somewhat hairy and high topout. Walk/scramble/shrub climb right to the ledge and down climb Down Not Out (V0-) or move directly up to top out and walk around the cliff line.
content.location: The most overhanging section of the Winter Wall. Start low on crimps.

content.description: Just left of Down, Not Out (V0-), climb the clean face on holds and horizontals to an easy top out. Really enjoyable climbing!
content.location: to the left of Down, Not Out and to the right of whack-a-bush

content.description:
The best wall/area at Barndoor Gap, with the highest concentration of problems. The Winter Wall is a cave like feature at the end of Barndoor gap. It's routes range from hard bouldering to easy trad. The rock here is of decent quality, though expect to break off some holds when trying to find new routes. 

  On the left side of the wall lies a thirty foot vertical crack system that goes at around 5.8. To the right the cave becomes overhanging at about forty-five degree, and hosts a variety of boulder problems. Still further right are several potential lines that could be done on TR or as highball problems.
